item.description:
SunDo: Postures of Yoga, Serenity of Meditation

SunDo Taoist Healing Arts hosts an introductory workshop with Taoist Master Hyunmoon Kim, an internationally renowned teacher and director of the Taoist Studies Program at Hanseo University in South Korea. The workshop focuses on natural meditative breathing as a way to achieve abundant health, energy and vitality.  In addition to discussion, participants will practice SunDo, a type of Taoist yoga.


Master Kim is known for his unique and humorous teaching style, combining the Eastern philosophical ideas with practical knowledge for modern society. His teachings help students reflect upon the real meaning of yoga, encouraging them to explore their higher potential.


Workshop participants will receive information on the SunDo Healing Arts Level 1 Program. With gentle yoga postures done in a fluid, meditative sequence in harmony with the breath, the program also includes a foundational study of Taoist philosophy, visualization methods for meditation and basic knowledge of energy healing practices.


The introductory workshop will be held from 11 am to 1 pm with a healthy snack and tea served for lunch. This is a free event; no fee is required!

 

SunDo is a tax-exempt non-profit committed to educating the public about the practice and principles of Taoism.
item.name: SunDo: Postures of Yoga, Serenity of Meditation
